summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 29, 2020, discussing a request for assistance from Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation. The emails involve multiple FBI agents coordinating volunteer efforts to review a large volume of evidence, with a project deadline set for the end of August 2020.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The primary point of contact for volunteers to assist with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation from Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT). Mentioned in the initial request email.

persons.name: Supervisory Special Agent
persons.context: An FBI supervisor in the New York Office Public Corruption unit who inquires about the time commitment for the assistance request.

persons.name: SAM
persons.context: An FBI agent who indicates willingness to assist with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation pending supervisor approval.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents involved in internal coordination regarding volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
SAM states willingness to assist 'if my SSA approves', indicating a supervisory relationship.

events.title: FBI Request for Assistance on Epstein/Maxwell Case
events.description: FBI Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) circulates an internal request for assistance related to the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, seeking volunteers to help process a large volume of evidence.

events.title: Evidence Review Project Deadline
events.description: One of the evidence review projects related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation has a turnaround time set for the end of August 2020.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking internal volunteer assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
Squad C-20, focusing on Violent Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking (VCAC/HT), was leading this evidence review effort.
The investigation involved a 'large volume of evidence' requiring significant time to process.
The email chain indicates ongoing, coordinated investigative activity well after Jeffrey Epstein's death in 2019.
